disclaimer: This information is for educational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. Consult a licensed attorney for legal guidance.

cleanSlateAutomatic.name: Clean Slate Automatic Expungement
cleanSlateAutomatic.description: New Jersey's automatic expungement process - no petition required for eligible records
eligibilityCriteria: 10-year crime-free period from most recent conviction, fine payment, or sentence completion
No new convictions during the 10-year waiting period
Offense is not one of the excluded offenses
All court obligations satisfied
process: State Police automatically identifies eligible records
Individual may verify through State Police

indictableOffense.name: Indictable Offense (Felony) Expungement
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for eligible non-excluded indictable offense
10-year waiting period completed (5 years for early pathway)
No subsequent convictions during waiting period
All fines, restitution, and court costs paid
No pending criminal charges
No more than one indictable conviction (for early pathway)
process: Obtain criminal record from NJ State Police
Complete Notice of Expungement Order (Form C)
File with Superior Court in county where arrest occurred
Serve County Prosecutor, Attorney General, State Police
indictableOffense.fees: $75 filing fee (may be waived for indigent)

disorderlyPersons.name: Disorderly Persons Offense Expungement
disorderlyPersons.description: Expungement for disorderly persons and petty disorderly persons offenses (misdemeanor-level)
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for eligible disorderly persons offense
5-year waiting period completed (4 years for early pathway)
No subsequent convictions during waiting period
All fines and court costs paid
No pending criminal charges
ineligibleOffenses: Criminal contempt in domestic violence case

municipalOrdinance.name: Municipal Ordinance Violation Expungement
eligibilityCriteria: Conviction for municipal ordinance violation
2-year waiting period completed
No subsequent convictions during waiting period
All fines paid
process: File with Superior Court (not Municipal Court)

arrestNoConviction.name: Arrest Without Conviction Expungement
arrestNoConviction.description: Expungement for arrests that did not result in conviction
eligibilityCriteria: Arrest with no conviction entered
Charges dismissed (NOT as part of plea bargain)
Acquittal at trial
Grand jury no-bill (refused to indict)
Charges not filed within statute of limitations
process: Verify case disposition shows no conviction
Obtain proof of dismissal or acquittal
arrestNoConviction.note: Does NOT apply to charges dismissed as part of plea bargain

youngDrugOffender.name: Young Drug Offender Expungement
youngDrugOffender.description: Special expungement for young drug offenders
eligibilityCriteria: Under 21 years old at time of offense
Drug possession offense only (no distribution)
No prior drug convictions
No other criminal convictions on record
process: Verify age at time of offense (under 21)
Obtain proof of discharge from probation/sentence

drugCourtGraduate.name: Drug Court Graduate Expungement
drugCourtGraduate.description: Immediate expungement pathway for drug court graduates
eligibilityCriteria: Successfully completed drug court program
No new criminal charges
All program requirements satisfied
drugCourtGraduate.waitingPeriod: Upon successful completion of drug court
process: Obtain proof of drug court completion
drugCourtGraduate.note: Special provision for drug court graduates - no waiting period

cleanSlateVerification: New Jersey State Police criminal record check
petitionBased: Complete copy of criminal record from NJ State Police
Proof of payment of all fines, costs, and restitution
Filing fee ($75) or fee waiver application
indictableOffense: Verification of single indictable conviction (for early pathway)
Documentation of compelling circumstances (for early pathway)
arrestNoConviction: Certified copy of dismissal or acquittal order
Proof that dismissal was NOT part of plea bargain

timelineFactors.impact: May add 30-60 days to processing time
Requires hearing and may extend timeline significantly
Petitions with missing information will be rejected
Each county requires separate petition if arrests occurred in multiple counties
Automatic expungements processed on rolling basis; may take several months for verification

options: Appeal to Appellate Division within 45 days
Wait and refile if eligibility issues can be resolved
appealsProcess.note: Consult an attorney if your expungement is denied

countyVariations.note: New Jersey has 21 counties (called vicinages for judicial purposes)
countyVariations.filingLocations: Petitions must be filed in Superior Court of the county where arrest occurred

howToCheck.description: Request criminal history record - expunged records will not appear
Case search - expunged cases not publicly accessible

cleanSlateVerification.note: If expunged records still appear, contact the court or NJ State Police

partiesToServe: Any other law enforcement agency involved
serviceRequirements.method: Certified mail with return receipt or personal service
serviceRequirements.proofRequired: Proof of service must be filed with court

formB.name: Order for Expungement
formB.purpose: Proposed order for judge to sign if expungement granted

formC.name: Notice of Expungement Order
formC.purpose: Notice to be sent to all relevant agencies after order is signed

formsGuide.whereToObtain: NJ Courts website or Superior Court Clerk's office
